Pre-Game Insights: The Philadelphia Phillies have the third-ranked team batting average in the NL at.260.
The Miami Marlins are 38-17 in games when they have more hits than their opponents.
The Phillies have a 7-5 advantage in the season series against the Marlins this season.

Phillies: Rodolfo Castro is on the 60-day IL (thumb), Alec Bohm is on the 10-day IL (hand), Austin Hays is on the 10-day IL (kidney infection), Spencer Turnbull is on the 60-day IL (back), Luis Ortiz is on the 60-day IL (ankle).

Marlins: Derek Hill is on the 10-day IL (shoulder), Calvin Faucher is on the 15-day IL (shoulder), Max Meyer is on the 15-day IL (shoulder), Andrew Nardi is on the 60-day IL (elbow), Edward Cabrera is day-to-day (migraine), Vidal Brujan is on the 10-day IL (shoulder), Dane Myers is on the 60-day IL (ankle), Braxton Garrett is on the 60-day IL (elbow), Ryan Weathers is on the 60-day IL (finger), Sixto Sanchez is on the 60-day IL (shoulder), Jesus Luzardo is on the 60-day IL (back), and Eury Perez is on the 60-day IL (elbow), and Sandy Alcantara is on the 60-day IL (elbow).
Others: The Phillies and Marlins are set to play the 13th meeting between the two teams this season.
